isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - WT TRANSMISSION DIAGNOSTIC CODES - CODE READING AND CODE CLEARING PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: CODE READING AND CODE CLEARING PROCEDURE

svcprocinfo.para: The diagnostic display mode may be entered for viewing of codes at any speed. Active codes can only be cleared when the output speed = 0 and no output speed sensor failure is active. The codes can be cleared by two methods: by using an electronic diagnostic tool with the appropriate software or by using the Shift Selector Display. The use of the electronic service tool is described in the instruction manual furnished with each tool and software, and will not be discussed in this manual. The method of reading and cleaning codes described in this section refers to only entering the Diagnostic Display Mode by proper button and/or shift lever movement.

note.para: The diagnostic display mode on the shift selector may only be entered when the vehicle is stopped. The vehicle is stopped when sensor output speed = zero and no output speed sensor failure is active; OR if any output speed sensor failure is active (code 22 16) when turbine speed = zero. Codes may only be cleared under the same circumstances.

svcprocinfo.para: The following describes how to use the shift selector to read and clear codes.

step1.para: The vehicle must be stopped. The transmission should be shifted into neutral and the vehicle park brake applied.

note.para: If a CHECK TRANS light on condition is present at this time, the lever may or may not respond to requested range changes.

step1.para: Momentarily depress the MODE BUTTON (Allison logo) on the shift selector or the (Up) and (Down) arrow buttons on the push button selector. (If an oil level sensor is present, repeat step.) Read the first code in the first of five code positions on the digital display on the shift selector. The digital display shows the first code in three steps. For example, code 25 11 located in the first position would be read as follows:

step2.para: First the code list position is displayed as "d1."
Then two seconds later, the display will show the main code 25.
Then two seconds later, the display will show the secondary code 11.
Then, if no further action is taken, the display will rerun the cycle of A, B, C as described above.

step1.para: To read the second position, d2, on the code list, press the MODE BUTTON or up and down arrows momentarily, and the second code on the list will be displayed in the same manner as in Step 2.

To read positions d3, d4, and d5, momentarily depress the MODE BUTTON or up and down arrows as explained in Step 3. Momentarily pressing the MODE BUTTON or up and down arrows after viewing the fifth code will cause the first code to be displayed again, etc.

When in the DIAGNOSTIC MODE, the LED indicator will be illuminated when the code being displayed is ACTIVE. When in a normal operating mode, the LED indicator illuminates to show that the transmission is in a secondary mode of operation.

Any code position in the list of five which does not have a diagnostic code logged will display "--" for both the main and sub-code displays. Any code position in the list of five after such a display will also be displayed in the same way (--) as they will not contain any data.
Clearing of the "active indicator" is automatically done at ECU power-down (turn key off) on all but code 69 24.
Some codes will clear the "active indicator" automatically when the condition causing the code is no longer detected by the ECU.
Manual clearing is possible while in the diagnostic display mode and after the condition causing the code is corrected.

step2.para: To clear all active indicators, hold the MODE BUTTON down continuously until the LED indicator flashes (3 seconds).
Release the MODE BUTTON to return to normal operation mode. If no codes are active at the time, the active indicator will turn off.
